reference: John Beshears, David Laibson, James J. Choi, and Brigitte C. Madrian, The Importance of Default Options for Retirement Savings Outcomes: Evidence from the United States, written for the sixth annual conference of the Center for Research on Pensions and Welfare Policies, Turin, 2005.
Dora L. Costa, The Evolution of Retirement, Chicago and London: The University of Chicago Press, 1998.
Peter A. Diamond and Peter R. Orszag, Saving Social Security: A Balanced Approach, Washington: Brookings Institution Press, revised edition, 2005.
Jonathan Gruber and David A. Wise, Introduction and Summary, in Gruber and Wise (eds.), Social Security and Retirement around the World, University of Chicago Press, 1999, pages 1-35.
